snippet: Officials said the attack, in which the assailant used his cousin to gain access before poisoning and shooting the officers, was the third of its kind in Helmand Province in less than two weeks.
abstract: Afghan officials report that Taliban forces have fatally shot at least five police officers in Helmand Province, after the officers were poisoned by a police commander working with Taliban; is third attack of this kind in province in two weeks.

byline.original: By TAIMOOR SHAH and MUJIB MASHAL
byline.contributor: Taimoor Shah reported from Kandahar, and Mujib Mashal from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Officials said the attack, in which the assailant used his cousin to gain access before poisoning and shooting the officers, was the third of its kind in Helmand Province in less than two weeks.

headline.main: Police Officers Are Killed at a Checkpoint in Afghanistan’s South
headline.print_headline: 5 Afghan Police Officers Are Killed at a Checkpoint
